workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 3.2 - Easy Progress
workout_file.description: A progressive zone 2 workout featuring cadence increases every interval.

textevent.message: Welcome back for a low key workout today :-)
Let's get started with a short warmup, then get into some progressive zone 2 today.
Do a quick check to make sure you have your fan, towel, and fluids all set.
All right, 1min to go then we're going to settle into 50min of zone 2.
We'll be using a progressive approach today both with intensity and cadence.
Starting off at 75 RPM and progressing up to 95 by the last interval.
All right, bring your cadence to ~75 RPM to start and let's settle into things.
Here we go. Nice and easy here and focus on keeping your cadence slow.
Feel free to stand up as needed today if you need a stretch.
Working at lower cadences is a good way to dial in your pedal stroke.
I like to repeat 'push, scrape, pull, kick' and focus on 1 leg, then the other.
That mental picture is a good way to create a more well-rounded pedal stroke.
However, the majority of your power comes from the downstroke portion.
Just 1min to go here, then we're going to move up the ladder.
Perfect! Now aim for ~80 RPM and again focusing on the pedal stroke.
Use that 'push, scrape, pull, kick' and try to separate out each quadrant.
Do you feel weaker, or awkward in 1 segment?
If so, spend some time trying to target just that single quadrant.
Another minute here, my friend! Good work today so far.
Now up to ~85 RPM. The 85-95 RPM range is where most feel comfortable.
Can you still separate each quadrant of the pedal stroke out at this RPM?
Make sure to still drink frequently even though the intensity is low.
Aiming for about 1 bottle per hour.
Up next, we're progressing up to 90 RPM.
Even quicker now. You should still feel comfortable here and in control.
Form check: Shoulders relaxed? Elbows bent slightly? Light grip on the bars? Well done!
Days like these are important to balance out the high intensity workouts.
You can't just hammer yourself day in and day out if you want to progress.
All right, final minute here then we'll finish up at 95 RPM.
At this RPM, make sure you're not bouncing and/or lurching back and forth in the saddle.
Keep the hips planted in the saddle.
Great work today! The legs should feel really good after we're done.
Shake out the tension in the shoulders, keep relaxed.
Final minute, then we'll finish up with the cooldown. Awesome job today!
All right, that was a solid day today! Great work with the cadence changes too.
We'll take 5min to cooldown now, then we check another one off the list!
See you next time :-)
